definition: marriage by capture/bride kidnapping
see 搶風|抢风[qiang1 feng1]
to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch
to marry/marriage/wedding/to take a wife

sentences.english: It turned out that a number of tribes in ancient China, there is looting marriage customs.
sentences.chinese: 原來，在古代中國的一些部落，有搶婚的習俗。

sentences.english: The marriage by kidnapping was the result of mankind society.
sentences.chinese: 搶婚是人類社會某一歷史階段的產物。

sentences.english: The grabbing-bride ceremony is a rare custom nowadays.
sentences.chinese: 搶婚的風俗現在已經很少見了。

sentences.english: A love match should be at the wishes of both sides, how can they grab a bride?
sentences.chinese: 戀愛婚姻需要男女雙方自願，怎麼能搶婚呢？

definition: the rice is cooked/what's done is done/it's too late to change anything now (idiom)
pinyin: sheng1 mi3 zhu3 cheng2 shu2 fan4

definition: variant of 定親|定亲[ding4 qin1]
lit. neither a relative nor a friend (idiom)/fig. unrelated to one another in any way
all crows are black (idiom)/evil people are bad all over the world
pinyin: tian1 xia4 wu1 ya1 yi1 ban1 hei1

definition: comic monologue/one-person comic sketch
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
protective coloration/camouflage
foolish talk/nonsense
female gossip/busybody
to go around in circles/to make a detour/(fig.) to beat about the bush
men and women should not touch hands when they give or receive things (citation, from Mencius)
pinyin: nan2 nu:3 shou4 shou4 bu4 qin1

definition: to make fun of/to seek diversion
lit. to assess the head and discuss the feet (idiom); minute criticism of a woman's appearance/fig. to find fault in minor details/nitpicking/overcritical
to behave unscrupulously
trivial matter/a piece of cake
